questions.question_text:
During the Sprint, the Development Team realizes they might not be able to finish all of the items in the Sprint Backlog.
What should happen?

choices.A: Product Backlog items are either 'done' or 'not done.' This helps with transparency, reduces complexity and allows for improved empiricism.
choices.C: The Sprint length holds and the Development Team continuously learns what is actually possible to do within the time-box.
choices.B: Continue Sprinting until the work is complete and redefine a new Sprint time-box based on the results of the current Sprint.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about the length of the Sprints?

choices.D: The Sprint Length is defined by the Scrum Master.
choices.B: The Sprint length is dependent on the development effort forecasted (amount of items selected) during Sprint Planning.
choices.C: The Sprint length is calculated by aggregating the time required to design, code and test.
choices.A: All Sprints must be one month or less and it is optimal to have a consistent Sprint length.

discussion.content: A is correct
B is correct
